terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.groups
Class OrbitGroup

java.lang.Object
  javax.media.j3d.SceneGraphObject
      javax.media.j3d.Node
          javax.media.j3d.Group
              terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.GroupChain
                  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.groups.ActuatorGroup
                      terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.groups.ActuatorTransformGroup
                          terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.actuators.groups.OrbitGroup
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActuationTarget, EnableTarget, PseudoActuator
public class OrbitGroup
extends ActuatorTransformGroup
implements PseudoActuator

An actuator group that supports geometric orbiting (e.g. a view about its look-at-point). The transformation is expressed as a series of right-handed Euler rotations applied in a specific order such that Y is heading about the original target-relative Y axis (the head transform), X is elevation about the new X axis, and Z is twist about the new Z axis (the tail transform).

The transforms in this group are for single-user use and should not be accessed or manipulated externally.

The input actuation value is defined as follows:

  • X - Orbit X angle (elevation) value in radians.
  • Y - Orbit Y angle (heading) value in radians.
  • Z - Orbit Z angle (twist) value in radians.
  • W - (ignored)

updateActuation

public void updateActuation(javax.vecmath.Tuple4d value)
Description copied from interface: ActuationTarget
Updates the target object actuation state to the specified value relative to the actuation reference value. The manner in which the new value is applied to the reference (additive, logarithmic, etc.) is specific to the target.

Specified by:
updateActuation in interface ActuationTarget
Parameters:
value - Actuation update value.

syncActuation

public void syncActuation()
Description copied from interface: ActuationTarget
Synchronizes the actuation reference value with the current target object actuation state. Typically called at the end of a drag operation so that the actuation offset will be cumulative.

Specified by:
syncActuation in interface ActuationTarget
